articleContent.title: Scale: Harmonic in F (Mode: Lydian #2, Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Introduction
The Harmonic in F scale is a unique and exotic scale that is also known as the Lydian #2 mode. This scale is based on the F note and follows a specific shape pattern with a characteristic raised second degree. It has a mystical and otherworldly sound due to its intervals, making it an interesting choice for musicians looking to add colorful and intriguing tones to their compositions.

# Notes and Intervals
The Harmonic in F scale, with the Lydian #2 mode shape starting on the G note, consists of the following notes: G, A#, B, C, D, E, F#. The intervals in this scale are: whole tone, augmented second, whole tone, whole tone, whole tone, whole tone.

# Genre and Musical Flavor
The Harmonic in F scale is often used in jazz, fusion, and world music genres. It has a dreamy and ethereal quality due to the raised second degree, creating tension and intrigue in musical passages. This scale can evoke a sense of mystery and wonder, making it a favorite among artists looking to experiment with unconventional sounds and harmonies.

# Songs

2. "Strasbourg / St. Denis" by Roy Hargrove
3. "Ancient Echoes" by Yusef Lateef
